Compatible with iOS 9 through 12

This open source tweak gives you many passcode customization options!

Passcode bypass options:
• Using an Activator action
• When connected to specific Wi-Fi networks or Bluetooth devices
• Within a certain time from last lock
• While using headphones

You can also choose if you want to automatically dismiss the lockscreen, or do so only when no notifications nor media controls are present.
There is also a FlipSwitch add-on to toggle the bypass.

Be able to lend your phone without the worry of telling someone your passcode!
Compose a sequence using the following "magic passcode" options:
• Time: minutes and hours
• Date: day and month
• Battery: remaining and used
• Custom digits
• Any of these, reversed

Or even use two digits to set a timeout after which the device locks again automatically!

Extra options:
• Show the last time the device was unlocked
• Disable auto-unlock and magic passcode, and optionally Touch ID/Face ID, during a specific time interval
• Disable the tweak when disabling Touch ID/Face ID by invoking SOS mode
• Save the passcode so to not require once every respring (passcode will always be stored encrypted for security reasons)

This tweak is now open-source

Configure options from Settings.

Changes in version 1.8.3: • Fixes WiFi and Bluetooth timeout state not being saved over resprings Changes in version 1.8.2: • Fixes an alert in preferences on iOS 12 • This tweak is now open-source Changes in version 1.8.1:
• Fixes the tweak for those without Activator installed


Changes in version 1.8:
• Added FlipSwitch support
• Added alphanumeric passcode support

• Bugfix: Passcode would sometimes be saved even if incorrect, sometimes causing the device to enter the annoying disabled state.
I apologize for the inconveniences this bug could have caused.
• Bugfix: Fixed rare crash when locking device and WiFi/Bluetooth concurrently changing state

• A successful Touch ID/Face ID login now re-enables the tewak after the time interval
• Activator action to disable tweak temporarily now also disables magic passcode

• The tweak will now warn users if they are trying to add an unprotected network to the witelist.
This is done for your security, as anyone could fake an open WiFi to which your device would connect, and therefore be able to unlock it.


This tweak will be open-sourced from release 2.0, which will bring many new and powerful features after I'm done with a big refactoring of the tweak's internals, hopefully out by the end of the year. Changes in version 1.6:
• Activator support! Use an Activator action to unlock your phone, or to disable auto-unlock until next real unlock!
NOTE: Activator is not a dependency (this is done so you can use this tweak without it) therefore you have to install it on your own if you want it
• iOS 9 support


Changes in version 1.5:
• Bugfix: Bluetooth devices settings were lost after resprings

• Timeouts are now maintained over resprings!
• Added option to allow enabling of auto-unlock even when Bluetooth/WiFi are connected while the device is locked

• Added a paypal button in settings for all the kind people out there willing to support a student. If you're enjoying this tweak, please consider donating!


Changes in version 1.4:
• Bugfix: on iOS 10 dismiss if no notifications would dismiss anyway
• Bugfix: disable in time interval would not work properly on certain intervals

• Added support for iOS 11.4
• Added 'hours' as a unit for timeouts
• Added option to keep the tweak disabled even after the time interval specified, until the next passcode unlock (or Touch ID/Face ID, if not disabled)
Changes in version 1.3:
• Bluetooth support!
• Added option to disable "PassBy Enabled" alert
• Added dialog to optionally attach settings when sending email feedback


Changes in version 1.2:
• Added option to save passcode (encrypted) over resprings
• Added option to disable during specified time interval
• Small bug fixes and refactoring


• Added full iOS 10 support!
• Fixed a bug which would send device to safe mode when custom digits text field contained only 1 character
• Fixed last unlock label showing last unlock attempt rather than only the last succeeded
• Added button to send feedback via email from the bottom of the settings page
